title: Container for Incense Tools
text: This rectangular ivory tube with <I>foo<I> dog finial cover contains a traveling set of tools for cleaning a joss stick holder and placing joss sticks in a censer. The tools include a plain ivory cleaning stick and a pair of silver placement rods, which are used like chopsticks to place joss sticks in the sand bed of a censer. The connoisseurship of rare incense was a common literati pastime and the special tools associated with it were often collector's items.
description: long square-bodied tube with screw-on cover, carved with seated lion; tube contains three long, thin tools:  two metal, one ivory
creditline: The Ruth Ann Dayton Chinese Room Endowment Fund
